title: My Minecraft House Tour - Minecraft Hardcore #24

comments.comment: This base is seriously insane, i just got to remember how and what he started with.. Truly crazy how amazing this place has become...
The fact that this started from a dirt house with a bee. Damn bruh, the journey and the progress he made to build his base.
So good to see a genuine passion for the game he once made fun off… That base is insane!
I find it funny that this base started off as a dirt whole in a mountain to hold a bee named bffftt
Felix unironically showed us his auto sorting system for the 5th time with the same enthusiasm as the first time. Strangely wholesome

Remember when he was confused because he couldn't ignite TNT with a torch. Watching him grow from a confused toddler to an apathetic capitalist overlord has been quite the journey. What's truly impressive is that he did it all on hardcore

Felix: Why is my game so laggy?

Also Felix: I built every automatic machine ever
14:26 two years later, see what we have. A crafter
It’s crazy because when he started out everyone was remaking and perfecting his base. I wouldn’t even know where to start replicating this !

What I expected: "Here's my cool builds, don't they look good!"

What I got: INDUSTRIAL REVOLUTION
Funny how some people tought Pewds had building teams, when he literally stream a whole day of him digging and clearing a whole mountain. Just to made the base we saw now.
14:05 THEY DID IT
It's actually quite insane what Felix have built up in his hardcore world, it's for sure one of the coolest hardcore worlds made in my opinion.
I don’t understand how a base could be this incredible. Especially in hardcore mode it blows me away every single time I see it. Also very enjoyable to watch Pewds get so into it and be so big brain

Felix then: “this is my bee and this is my hole”

Felix now: 
“absolutely everything i have is fully automatic” 
“one thing I am proud of, is my Minecraft wealth.”

Felix: "Why is my base so laggy?"
Also Felix: has hundreds of items shooting around his base
i love how felix came from not spending a single minute on the idea of playing minecraft to spending countless of hours on the game
It's so interesting to see how far Pewdiepie's Minecraft series has progressed
To make hoppers less laggy, you can put composters on the top of them. That makes it so the hopper isnt constantly searching for items to pick up

Felix: I know mojang is not going to build it. (Describes auto crafting)

Mojang: 1 year later

"I tried experimenting shooting items from the Nether into my ass"
- Pewdiepie (Minecraft veteran) 2021

Why does Felix keep thinking that we're not interested in any of this?

I love this stuff, it's chill and entertaining all the way! Keep making em'!
I already don't understand redstone builds, so this is just absolutely mindblowing
14:12 dang they in fact did do that with the crafter
The fact that this is all in Hardcore mode is even more impressive.
just reminding everyone that this guy started in a mountain cave with his bee friend. now, he's got an entire empire

The fact that he's in hardcore mode is crazy.
I could never build a base this complex even in creative mode.
14:00 the legend actually predicted the auto crafter years ago
I've been playing Minecraft for more than 10 years now and never have I done anything this huge even in creative. The fact that you did that in hardcore is just mind-blowing to me
This is literally the guy who tried to blow a TNT using a torch.

felix: “i’m not smart enough”

also felix: makes the most intricate and complicated sorting system to ever grace this planet
Yessss - 14:11-They Actually did that! The "Auto-Crafters"
His build and base is genuinely impressive - the fact that he did it all on hardcore mode makes it completely insane. This dude is legendary.

I love how he took all the farms and ideas from other people and incorporated his own style into it, instead of copying it 1 for 1! It's such a cool and unique base, better than anything I've ever made and I've been playing Minecraft forever LOL
"I think I'm done". If that means no more Minecraft, I'm gonna be sad. If it means he'll be starting a new world, I'll be happy.
14:05 Not Pewdiepie talking about the auto crafter a year before its release.

I'd like to imagine that if Marzia ever plays minecraft she'll just make the exact opposite of what Pewds has made. 
Pewdiepie's world: industrial fire nation
Marzia'z world: simple small house near a lake. A city filled with dogs, cats, pandas, and birds. And a flower garden.
I still cannot believe this man was trying to put a cat in a bucket.
The tour we all wanted but didn't deserve
i just realised that after 2 years, minecraft really made what felix requested
It has been a journey seeing Felix from shit talking minecraft to this piece of the art builds in hardcore mode.
i was paying attention to the way sive put different music for each of felix's areas , it made it slightly more immersive, good job sive!
Felix, put composters above all of your "transport" hoppers. Should reduce lag quite a bit
13:50  Well well well. Mojang made an automatic crafter. Thanks to Felix
Pewds- An automatic sorting system engineer....he is so proud of it that he talks about it in his every mc video.
This is honestly the most impressive thing i've ever seen in a hardcore world

I know Felix isnt a minecraft youtuber but i argue that he has the most amazing build ive ever seen. Just knowing how much different stuff he does but also put this amount of effort into minecraft is insane
14:00 Felix would not believe it when he hears about Crafters

Pewds a year ago: hehe temporary house 

Pewds now: there is no mountain left, I am an overlord who turned it into a place of slavery and capitalism
jokes apart , his world is really impressive , and the fact that its in hardcore mode and it could all end with one mistake scares me

little tip from me, if you want to reduce lag in your world look up all hopper that don't need the block above (like your sheep farm) and put a composter on them. This will stop the hoppers from searching blocks above and therefore reduces the lag
Mojang adding dog armor and autocrafter. Seems like they begging for Felix to come back to minecraft

Felix 2015: "I'm never gonna play minecraft again"
Felix 2021: "I have a semiautomatic netherwart farm"
From talking to a bee to making high level red stone engineer builds. Well done Felix, well done.
I wouldn't even have the patience or skill to build something like this in creative mode, let alone hardcore survival!
13:45 they actually added the autocrafter I can't believe it
Felix’s world is so impressive, like he started out on a hill with nothing but a bee and it has become a japanise temple that is super big and glorious
This is exactly like a factory tour that is done for school field trip at a sausage factory. The manager proudly walks them by each and every prodcution machine and tells how it works. Wholesome.

It really is impressive how you managed to combine automation and efficiency with design. Usually player built bases in games are a mess of farms/utility buildings, or a pretty but nonfunctional house. This is god tier.
13:59 1.21 made his wish come true

Damn, Felix's progression from trying to ignite TNT with a torch to a fully automated base is absolutely insane. Truly a Minecraft legend. 

Also this base is one of the coolest I've ever seen.
Seeing how much Pewds enjoys watching automatic farms, I really think he would enjoy modded Minecraft. (Especially technology mods like Industrial Craft, Immersive Engineering, and Forestry)

From laughing at his ignorance 2 years ago, to being BLOWN AWAY by his brilliance.
Proud of you, Pewds ^^
Felix so many things you asked for during this series are now in the game. Dog armor, a Redstone block that auto crafts items for you, trial ruins etc. perfect time for a handful of episodes ?
I love how he's so passionate explaining about his engineering work with the ASS and the effort he made for the entire house. Honestly, one of the best builds I know

For the lag. 
1. Put composters on top of hoppers
2. More torches around all the redstone so there is less lightening updates.
3. If your shader pack has ray tracing, turn it off lol not worth the performance hit. 
Hope this helps Felix.

Pewds before: tries to light tnt with a torch
Pewds now: just a standard automated sorting machine for almost every block in the game, nothing much
Even if he was inspired by designs from other people this still takes a lot of intelligence and caution to pull off in mf HARDCORE  absolutely insane
I'm just super impressed at all the intricate systems he managed to make. And the fact that pewds made all this while in hardcore mode is so awesome

The fact that you started playing minecraft barely a year and a half ago is just insane! I fully recreated and transformed your base because the design is so unique. It took me a month to fully recreate the base block by block and it shows the amount of work that has gone into it.
Ive been playing minecraft all my life and I've never built anything this impressive especially not in hardcore. This base is so cool and amazing im actually so jealous!
1 year later and automatic crafting is introduced.... automatic crafting is the last thing i expected minecraft to introduce... thank you pewdiepie for the idea

Everyone: “We want a tour of Felix’s house”

Felix: “Best I can do is Minecraft house”

Everyone: “Understandable have a great day”
It’s exactly how you’d expect pewdiepie to create his Minecraft House. And he is humble about it.

It's been quite a journey, not gonna lie. I do really feel proud of him. And the way he's talking about everything he did in his world... you can tell that he's also proud of himself. I'm very happy to be here today, after these 2 way too short years!
Felix is the Walter White of minecraft, started from a hole to being a gigantic capatalist mega building overlord
He needs to put composers on top of the hoppers that don’t need to collect items from the top. It reduces lag by a lot.

Reasons why Felix would be a good programmer:

1. He loves to stand back and watch his creations work by themselves.
2. He Loves to steal peoples ideas and make them his own.
Pewds is a really good builder. I genuinely enjoy watching his progress.
13:48 the crafter idea is born. thank you PewDiePie
the fact that he glosses over the meatball/greenhouse made out of glass when he literally lost his mind building it during the livestream
It's so interesting that this is just a normal mountain before, love how Pewds progressed and loved Minecraft.

Pewdiepie: “youtubers do house tours, I do minecraft house tours”

Pewdiepie next week: uploads Japan house tour
Makes me really happy to see pewdipie doing good. He’s been around forever glad to see him enjoy life (from the looks of it).
2 years ago Felix didn't even know how to  enchant his weapons and now he has one of the best base's I've seen. That's epic WRYYYYY
08:40 I think if pewdiepie gets into industrially modded minecraft he would never stop playing it. Just imagine the things he could do with his will to automate and great aesthetic sense
14:00 They actually made it, the Crafter.
So... would you be able to sell your world as an NFT for millions now?!!!

It's interesting for me how Felix doesn't like possessions and having something or an object that he would be tied to, so him building this world in hardcore mode and obviously loving it so much is gonna be testing. For both him and me lol I'm obsessed.
I love how giddy he gets about it. Pure joy on his face

This is so cute and wholesome lol it's nice to see someone that isn't saying and doing things for views and likes and instead Pewds is just chillin doing his own thing and talking about what he likes regardless of that. I'm glad to be subscribed to you Pewds ! Most genuine youtuber out there.

I mean this with every fiber of my being, no exaggeration, your base is honest to god the most impressive Minecraft build I have EVER seen. AND THAT'S NOT EVEN MENTIONING THE FACT IT WAS ALL MADE IN HARDCORE MODE!
This is the closest we'll ever get to a Pewdiepie House tour.
I swear it's crazy you did this in hardcore, most people working on this scale use creative mode due to the convenience of flying and unlimited resources and stuff so this is really really impressive
13:48 1st time watching this because of his latest minecraft video after 2 years and now that they added the crafter we clearly see that mojang listens to pewdiepie
It’s crazy to think that he managed to build all of this in a hardcore map

It's amazing how he went from knowing nothing about Minecraft, to having one of the coolest bases in the entire Minecraft community across all the many series that have been done - all in the span of like 40-50 episodes of playing the game.
felix should definitely do a series with some industrial mods. considering how much he enjoys redstone, actual huge constructions should be fun
13:54 THEY DID IT
It's so endearing to see pewds be so proud and happy showing us his base. This is genuinely THE BEST minecraft base of all time.
